timeline.message: refactor s3 retry logic to be job based vs all or nothing. This should catch errors sooner

timeline.bodyText:
As per @massdosage

Move this to line 42, there's no point getting the duration if this is going to fail.
timeline.author: KenFigueiredo

timeline.bodyText:
As per @massdosage

I'm a bit confused why there are so many other changes to this class when the only change I can really see that is necessary is making this value configurable instead of a hardcoded value?
timeline.author: KenFigueiredo

replies.bodyText:
So it's two changes to resolve this issue:

Make the assume role time configurable to allow roles that have shorter assume durations than 12 hours
Don't cache the credential in our AssumeRoleCredentialProvider. The issue being that we we're holding the token and never refreshing it. If we had a replication that lasted more than 12 hours we'd start failing with expiredToken errors from AWS
replies.author: KenFigueiredo

replies.bodyText: To expand on that, Ken's changes now enable STSAssumeRoleSessionCredentialsProvider's built-in refresher background thread, so that the user of this class doesn't have to worry about calling refresh manually before the duration times out.
replies.author: barnharts4

replies.bodyText: OK, thanks for the further explanation, makes sense.
replies.author: massdosage
